is silly, because the overnight bus is comparable in price and faster.
Shonai Kotsu runs an overnight bus, the "Yuhi Express", from
in Tokyo to Tsuruoka. It takes about 8 hours from Shibuya to Tsuruoka at a cost of ¥7540 one way, ¥13,570 round trip.

value: directions=Just SW of Tsuruoka Park, opposite the traffic light.
content=This clan school, for samurai children, was built centuries ago by Sakai Tadanori.  It's the last of its kind in the region.

content=This temple, founded in the 1200s, is known for its five-storied pagoda.  There are several other temple buildings, too.

content=Movie buffs will want to detour to this little neighborhood bath, which was one of the key settings of the Japanese Oscar winner "Departures" (
).  They've been operating more or less unchanged since opening in 1941.

Tsuruoka's claim to culinary fame is
(だだちゃ豆), the local variant of the popular snack
.  The appearance and taste resembled peas in the pod, and many are surprised to find out that this, too, is actually made from soybeans.
